revised_title: Polarizability and Internuclear Distance in the Hydrogen Molecule and Molecule-Ion
tldr: The authors calculated the polarizability of the hydrogen molecule-ion for various internuclear distances using different wave-functions. The results show that the values of polarizability are not very sensitive to the choice of wave-function, suggesting that the LCAO treatment may provide reliable results for other systems, including the hydrogen molecule. The predicted variation of polarizability with internuclear distance agrees approximately with previous calculations, but further experimental data is needed for comparison.
